citations.narrative:
During the review of paperwork and records it was noted that the acquisition records were incomplete. The acquisition
records for a newly acquired Blue & Gold Macaw were unavailable at the time of inspection.
Appropriate documentation of acquired regulated animals is essential for proper identification, tracing forward and trace
back of the animals.
Each exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose information concerning
each animal purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or
her control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that exhibitor. The licensee must have
these forms available during inspection.
CORRECT BY: OCT 11, 2023

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
An environment enhancement plan (EEP) has not been established to promote the psychological well-being of the birds.
Failure to establish and maintain an EEP can result in birds not receiving adequate enrichment which can lead to
behavior, social, health, and other psychological problems.
Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow a species appropriate plan for
environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The licensee must establish and
maintain an EEP for the birds.
CORRECT BY OCT 11, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Charles Palmer, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
During the review  of paperwork and records it was noted that the acquisition records were incomplete. The acquisition 
records for a newly acquired Blue & Gold Macaw were unavailable  at the time of inspection.  
 
Appropriate documentation of acquired regulated animals is essential for proper identification, tracing forward and trace 
back of the animals. 
 
Each exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose information concerning 
each animal purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or 
her control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed of by that exhibitor. The licensee must have 
these forms available  during inspection.  
 
CORRECT  BY: OCT 11, 2023 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
An environment  enhancement plan (EEP) has not been established to promote the psychological well-being of the birds.  
 
Failure to establish and maintain an EEP can result in birds not receiving adequate enrichment which can lead to 
behavior,  social, health, and other psychological problems. 
 
Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow a species appropriate plan for 
environment  enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The licensee must establish and 
maintain an EEP for the birds. 
 
CORRECT  BY OCT 11, 2023

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Charles Palmer, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

species.common: GRAY WOLF / GREY WOLF / TIMBER WOLF
